radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT ABD & PELVIS W & W/O CONTRAST, ADDL SECTIONS
radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder wall is thickened up to 1.5 cm with irregularities in the mucosal enhancement consistent with infarcted mucosa. A pseudoaneurysm is seen possibly representing a pseudoaneurysm of a branch of the cystic artery or right hepatic artery. The CBD is prominent measuring 9 mm. Minimal atelectasis in the lung bases; no pleural or pericardial effusion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The known infarct in segment VI of the liver is similar to prior exam.
